dt: {bc}the introductory part of a constitution or statute that usually states the reasons for and intent of the law

et: Middle English, from Middle French {it}preambule{/it}, from Medieval Latin {it}preambulum{/it}, from Late Latin, neuter of {it}praeambulus{/it} walking in front of, from Latin {it}prae-{/it} + {it}ambulare{/it} to walk
shortdef: an introductory statement; especially : the introductory part of a constitution or statute that usually states the reasons for and intent of the law
an introductory fact or circumstance; especially : one indicating what is to follow
